bibl.note: This document is a letter dated December 24, 1839, from R. A. Ramsey in Chattanooga, Tennessee to Charles F. Welcker in Kingston, Tennessee. Ramsey is responding to an enquiry from Welcker and states that he intends to retain his current blacksmith at a price of 350 dollars.

To Mr.
C. F. Charles Frederick Welcker

div.p: Yours of the 10th Inst Instant has been received. in answer to which I have to say that I am hireing hiring the smith I have at $350, I consider him amongst the best of smiths. I cannot think that your woman would more than feed & cloth clothe her 3 children, of course consider it to my advantage to continue the smith I have, I hope this time by notice will enable you to hire your negros negroes to advantage
